Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Morphine in Preterm Neonates Undergoing Endotracheal Tube Suctioning

Trial_Design.evidence: In a multicenter, double-blind, randomised controlled trial, 898 ventilated preterm neonates from 16 centers were randomly assigned

Participants.evidence: Eligibility criteria included preterm neonates requiring mechanical ventilation.

Intervention.evidence: randomly assigned to receive either placebo (n=449) or morphine (n=449)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the neonatal response to ETT suctioning, measured at 20–28 and 70–76 hours after starting the drug infusion and 10–14 hours after discontinuation.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was computer-generated, and allocation was concealed.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors, patients, and clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 898 ventilated preterm neonates from 16 centers were randomly assigned

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 875 neonates were analyzed using a non-linear mixed effects model.

Result_Outcome.evidence: No significant relationship was found between morphine concentrations and heart rate changes or the Premature Infant Pain Profile.
